instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Macbook Pro 2016 A1707 820-00281-A not booting
threads.message:
Hi, I got the macbook pro 2016 820-00281-A that doesnt boot, I checked almost all rails and they are present, didnt find any short and the amp sequence looks ok but doesnt boot. trackpad enabled, keyboard shift key light not present, when I insert a usb stick its light turns on for a sec. but then no activity. with display disconnected and connected to external monitor same problem. I reflashed the bios with a clean me bin that I downloaded from this forum no difference.

L7211, L7221, L7231 on boot: 1.112 then 0.700 A

PCH and other chips get hot but not really hot (please see pics)
The videos are the amperage behaviour while booting, the first is with the battery attached, the second is without battery attached. When the battery is connected doesnt make one reboot cycle. I think the battery is already charged because before with the battery connected it was using like 1Amp more. Both videos are with the board connected (everything connected) I tried disconnecting one by one trackpad, keyboard, touchpad, etc and same problem.

Battery attached
[MEDIA=imgur]a/SO7Fh0y[/MEDIA]

No Battery attached
[MEDIA=imgur]a/0enoGKa[/MEDIA]

threads.title: Macbook Pro 2016 A1707 820-00281-A not booting
threads.message:
Any history available?
CPU core should drop to 0.6V aprox, when machine really boots.

There may be CPU, or GPU problem.
PLT_RESET_L comes high?

threads.title: Macbook Pro 2016 A1707 820-00281-A not booting
threads.message:
No history it came like that "its not turning on anymore, fans spin but nothing comes on the screen" 
no signs of water nothing..

PLT_RST_L : 3.3V

threads.title: Macbook Pro 2016 A1707 820-00281-A not booting
threads.message:
"PLT_RST_L : 3.3V"
Once power on sequence is completed, there must be some communication problem on a data bus.
"There may be CPU, or GPU problem."

threads.title: Macbook Pro 2016 A1707 820-00281-A not booting
threads.message: hmmmm is a there a procedure to check if it is a CPU or GPU problem?

threads.title: Macbook Pro 2016 A1707 820-00281-A not booting
threads.message: Not sure if helps on this model; lift GPU core coils and check if CPU core drops to 0.6V.
